characters: SNOW WHITE GOES THROUGH FIRE TO THE SIDE DOOR. -
RABBITS SIDE BY SIDE, EXOTIC FLOWERS AND EVERYWHERE THE L
TORTOISE FORMATION _ SNOW WHITE FIGHTS _ SNOW WHITE LOOKS
WHEN SUDDENLY HER BODY SHATTERS INTO A FLOCK OF SHRIEKING
BUTTERFLIES, BUBBLING STREAMS, MOSS COVERED TORTOISES, FO
OVER A TIME-LAPSE IMAGE OFA ROTTING RED AND WHITE APPL
-- SUDDENLY AN ARROW FLIES THROUGH THE AIR
TWENTY FEET TALL. IT'S NOT A BRIDGE AT ALL BUT A --
A PAIR OF EYES OPENS IN THE STONE, AND SLOWLY THE BRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above we see the castle gardens covered in a bl of snow. We hear the tread of footsteps then see a beauti WOMAN in a fur-lined cloak heading towards an unseen obje

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Once upon a time, in deep winter, a Queen was admiring the falling snow when she saw a rose blooming in defiance of the cold. The rose looks miraculously red. Nearby, a RAVEN looks on Queen gazes at the flower, then bends down.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Reaching for it, she pricked her finger and three drops of blood fell. BOOM -- with the impact of an artillery shell, a DROP OF lands in the snow. Followed by ANOTHER. And ANOTHER. The Queen startles, then calmly touches her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And because the red seemed so alive against the white, she thought, if only I had a child as white as snow, lips as red as blood, hair as black as a raven's wings and all with the strength of that rose. A beat, then we hear the piercing cry of a new-born baby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find ourselves in a crowded chamber full of MIDWIVES a PHYSICIANS. Moving through the chaos we glimpse buckets o water, dirty sponges, astrology charts and protection cha until we see a BABY GIRL in the arms of her happy mother.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Soon after, a daughter was born to the Queen and was named "Snow White." With a radiant smile, the Queen offers SNOW WHITE to her father, KING MAGNUS. The baby's CRIES grow louder as the cradles her gently in his arms, turning towards a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC V/O
dialogues.text: And she was adored throughout the kingdom as much for her defiant spirit as for her beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wounded MAGPIE is twitching in a puddle of water. SNOW aged 7 now, steps towards it hesitantly, looking concerne

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SNOW WHITE
dialogues.text: Pick it up, William. Her companion, William, also 7, braces himself, reaches d then steps back in alarm as the bird starts flapping wild tries to cover his embarrassment by sounding knowledgeabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dying. It doesn't want to be touched. Snow White ignores him, approaching the bird herself. She down, hesitates, then reaches out and strokes the magpie, calming its flapping before she picks it up. High up on a tree, ANOTHER MAGPIE looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOW WHITE runs, cupping the wounded bird in her hand, Wi dashing after her. The sun is out and the fields and fore lit up in all their glory. The children sprint through a BEAUTIFUL SEASIDE VILLAGE -- thatched homes with flower g HAPPY FARMERS and FAIR VILLAGE MAIDENS --

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SNOW WHITE
dialogues.text: Hurry, William! Hurry! They run down the dunes, waves crashing, the sand gleamin the sunlight, until they see the BEAUTIFUL CASTLE up ahea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single apple tree stands in the middle of the cloisters stands out. Snow White and William dash past it into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White bursts into her parent's chamber. The King and turn from the window. Two PHYSICIANS are in attendance. S White is too young and preoccupied to notice but her moth smile is tinged with sadness and her father looks heartbr

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SNOW WHITE
dialogues.text: We found it in the woods. The Queen takes the wounded magpie from Snow White. The K looks on sadly as she pulls a RIBBON from Snow White's ha carefully binds the magpie's wing. William watches from t doorway, noticing how frail the Queen looks. The magpie's flapping gradually calms, its pain easing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will heal in time. Snow White's eyes are fixed on the little bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look after it. The King watches Snow White, hiding his sorrow behind a s So does the Queen, holding back her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You possess a rare beauty, my love. In here. (She touches Snow white's heart) Never lose it. Hold it dear. You will need its strength to one day become Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White and William, with a small toy bow strapped to back, climb the branches of the apple tree in the cloiste gardens. William picks a DISTINCTIVE RED AND WHITE APPLE offers it to Snow White. He makes a point of the offer, holding it out, nodding. Just as she comes to take it he pulls it away and takes a huge bite himself, grinning. Snow White shoves him off th tree and they fall to the ground. And now we PULL BACK to reveal the King and William's fat DUKE HAMMOND, watching from the throne room balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter will need your son's friendship more than ever, Duke Hammond. As will I yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are here to serve you, your Majesty. As the King watches his daughter, ERIC'S VOICEOVER resume

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.0)
dialogues.text: The next winter was the harshest in memory and Snow White's mother passed away. Ba EXT. GARDENS/ CASTLE - DAY. 8a The garden is covered in snow but there is no red rose no Magnus walks with his arm around Snow white, heartbroken. A single tear rolls down Snow White's cheek. Palace onloo and mourners, fixed on her face, feeling what she feels, aside.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.0)
dialogues.text: A year went by but the King was inconsolable. Taking advantage of his grief, dark forces gathered on the kingdom's borders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From above we see horses movie through the forest and ent clearing. At the head is -- King Magnus, with Duke Hammond by his side, surrounded by line of the King's Army. They are frozen as they look at- Across the battlefield - Horsemen in a line. THE RIDERS a silhouetted on a misty plain -- a VAST SHADOW ARMY of fac warriors. King Magnus and the Duke trade a look -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what hell comes this army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hell they'll soon revisit! King Magnus SCREAMS A BLOOD CRY, kicks his horse and ride forward with blind courage, no longer caring what happens him. The two lines of warriors race, pell-mell to the center o the battlefield. When they meet -- Hand to hand combat at its most brutal. King Magnus swings his great sword, and a SHADOW WARRIOR SHATTERS LIKE GLASS. All down the line the same is happening - Shadow Warriors shattering, evaporating. Strange. DUKE HAMMOND shatters an opponent as well and as loud and furious as the battlefield was only moments before, it is that quiet. The King and the Duke watch in amazement as the rest of t SHADOW ARMY melts away, DISSOLVING INTO THE MORNING MIST all that is left in the field is --

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The unholy army was defeated, leaving King Magnus with the spoils of victory. A CAGED PRISON WAGON. Odd. Not even sure how it got there King Magnus moves toward it, with a little trepidation. W he's close he gets off his horse, walks closer and dares look inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the cage, a WOMAN COWERS, her face hidden behind a King Magnus stares at her through the prison bars, then w mighty blow of his sword shatters the lock and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now free. You have nothing to fear from me. Duke Hammond watches from outside the cage, a bit wary, a King kneels beside the terrified woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your name, my lady? Slowly, the woman turns. For a moment the King wonders if his beloved Queen behind the veil. Gently, he lifts her v It's not his wife, but the most beautiful woman he's ever

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Ravenna, sire. The King is speechless now, gazing upon the face of an an

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So struck by her beauty was the King, that he forgot, for the first time, his broken heart. His gaze is so intense that Ravenna looks down for a mome When she lifts her head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10a INT. GYPSY WAGON - FLASHBACK - DAY. l0a YOUNG RAVENNA - her face reflected in a small hand mirror Ravenna as a child, beautiful but poor, looks into the mirror. Her MOTHER, a gypsy woman in tattered clothes, mo the mirror closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This - is all that can save you, Ravenna. The young Ravenna looks away, distracted by SHOUTS and COMMOTION outside. 10b EXT. GYPSY CAMP - SAME - DAY. 10b A little boy, FINN, runs as fast as he can through the sn toward the Gypsy Camp. Behind him, THE KING'S RIDERS advance on the camp.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE THE WAGON
dialogues.text: Ravenna's mother tries to keep her daughter's attention -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6 10b CONTINUED: 10b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna!

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: Present day. Still as a statue and even more beautiful as cheeks are powdered, eyebrows plucked and lips painted by several sets of HANDS. Her eyes stare straight ahead, unblinking, her mind elsewhere. Attendants are preparing Ravenna for her wedding to the K

dialogues.speaker: SNOW WHITE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You're so beautiful... Ravenna snaps to and looks into the face of Snow White, reverential, standing a few feet away. Ravenna's face softens as she looks at the face of Snow White. Ravenna beckons to her with a look and then holds her arm - "Come." As Snow White steps forward, the handmaidens withdraw unt only one is left, weaving beautiful flowers in Ravenna's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is kind, child. Especially when it is said that yours is the face of true beauty in this kingdom. Snow White doesn't quite know how to answer this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A warm smile) Would you like to be dressed up like this and married one day? Snow White nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you'll invite me?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SNOW WHITE
dialogues.text: Of course. Snow White smiles, enchanted by her new friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it is difficult, child. When I was your age I, too, lost my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. A King tore me from her arms, dressed me in lace and stole my innocence. Snow White's smile dies a bit; confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can never take your mother's place, but I feel that you and I are bound. (touches her heart) I feel it here. Snow White mimics, touching her own heart, and smiles at Ravenna. It should be a touching moment but something in Snow White's face - the way her smile lights up the room gives Ravenna pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna, in a stunning dress,.walks down the center aisle the NOBLES in the land are present. Ravenna looks at them, on either side of the aisle. They smiling, nodding appreciation. But they aren't really loo at Ravenna. She follows their gaze to -- Snow White, behind, holding the folds of silk from the wedding dress. Snow White looks up, adoringly, at Ravenna As the bride and groom reach the altar, KING MAGNUS turns smiles, the happiest man alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Magnus lies on the bed, drunk - half with wine and h with lust. His eyes fixed on -- Ravenna, in a sheer silk nightgown standing near the fire holding a goblet. Staring a seductive hole through him. She starts slowly toward him, never taking her eyes off h He licks his lips - can't wait for her to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gazing at her lustfully) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bane of Kings. When she does arrive she slowly crawls onto the bed, roll him on his back, straddles him and offers the goblet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sup, my lord. King Magnus drains the goblet, tosses it and gropes her b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you are mine. Her eyes gleam in the firelight. Magnus tries to playfull wrestle her off, but she grabs his hands and holds him do firmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will destroy you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, you will. She rips open his shirt then bends down and kisses him on lips. He can't believe how good she tastes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As my people were destroyed. As my family was destroyed. As I would have been destroyed. He is slightly confused by this and his face begins to sh discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when a woman stays young forever - no man can resist her - and the world is hers. He suddenly STARTS TO CHOKE, his eyes widening in surpris As he struggles for breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I will take your life, my lord. Then I will take your throne. She reaches beneath the sheets, pulls out an ORNATE DAGGE and BRINGS IT DOWN THROUGH HIM -- 13a EXT. OUTSIDE ROYAL BEDROOM 13a Several Guards line the hallway. The door opens and Raven emerges. As she moves past them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King has laid down his sword for the night. Their eyes take her, lustfully, in as she strides away an disappears around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 13b INT. GYPSY WAGON - FLASHBACK - DAY. 13b Ravenna's mother takes Ravenna's hand and holds it over a bowl of white liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must trust me, my love. With a small blade she nicks Ravenna's wrist. Three drops blood fall into the white liquid - BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! Finn, Ravenna's brother blasts through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming! The King's men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink! Ravenna chokes it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink! And with it the ability to steal youth and beauty! For that is your ultimate power and only protection. Finn steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will protect my sister! Ravenna's mother reaches out and touches her son's forehe closes her eyes, an incantation of sorts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it shall be, Finn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna exits the castle and crosses the courtyard with a lantern. A portcullis opens and DARK FIGURES emerge from shadows, entering the castle. Leading them is a tall pale warrior (FINN). He looks at Ravenna devotedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the shadows of the invaders sweeping through the corridors, putting the King's sleeping soldiers to the sw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White lies asleep when she hears a bell ringing. At she thinks she's dreaming, but then she hears cries of al She sits up curiously, then climbs out of bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's panic and chaos outside, COURTIERS and SOLDIERS r for their lives. Snow White stares in confusion, then run

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White rushes towards her father's chamber and sees R at the end of the corridor. Relieved, she hurries towards stepmother when suddenly she notices her father's lifeles lying on the bed. FINN and his KNIGHTS appear beside Rave takes a moment for the betrayal to sink in, tears of shoc welling in Snow White's eyes, before she turns and flees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chaos has spread to the courtyard, DUKE HAMMOND'S KNI struggling to hold back the invaders. Snow White hurries dazed by the sight of battle, then sees William pull free father's guards and run towards her -- William grabs her protectively when strong arms reach dow lift them both onto the back of separate horses. Duke Ham and his personal guard are attempting to ride out of the before the portcullis closes. The Duke rides under the portcullis with William. His bod is about to follow when an ARROW FROM FINN STRIKES HIM IN BACK and both he and Snow White are thrown off their hors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father! The Princess! But the portcullis is down, separating Snow White and Wil The last thing he sees is Snow White struggling in Finn's being hauled back into the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna walks from statue to painting to urn, toppling an tearing them from the walls. Cleaning house. Ravenna's so deliver a large object, then leaving her alone. A BEAUTIF MIRROR rests against the wall. Ravenna stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirror, mirror, on the wall Who is the fairest of them all? There'.s a brief silence, then the surface of the mirror LIQUID-spills onto the floor where it reforms into the sh THE MIRROR MAN. His body is a veil of reflective bronze b face-is a distorted version of Ravenna's own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it is you, my Queen! Yet another kingdom falls to your glory! Is there no end to your power and beauty? Ravenna smiles, moves to the center of the room, raises h and drunk with power -- SCREAMS! The scream becomes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20a EXT. GYPSY WAGON - FLASHBACK - DAY. 20a Young Ravenna's SCREAM as she is ripped from her mother's arms. Finn throws himself into the mix but is backhanded the ground. Ravenna's mother moves forward, ready to atta The Guard holding Ravenna pulls a dagger and puts it to Ravenna's throat, which stops her mother. Ravenna is dragged away and tossed on the back of a horse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But be warned Ravenna: By fairest blood it is done and only by fairest blood can it be undone. Ravenna looks back to see her mother and other gypsies pu the sword. Finn struggles free and chases after the King's men as th gallop away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20b EXT. COURTYARD - NIGHT. 20b All the wedding guests and nobles stand, held there by gu with swords and daggers. Ravenna stands at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So kind of you all to stay over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shall we do with these? She eyes the noblemen and guests from left to right. Thei eyes beg for mercy. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 20b CONTINUED: 20b There are GASPS and SCREAMS as the Guards move the guests away. Ravenna notices Finn, off to one side, his dagger at the of Snow White, who stares defiantly at Ravenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn! Finn stops his exit with Snow White, and turns. Ravenna stares at the little girl, not sure where she stands with this one. And then,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock her away. One never knows when royal blood may be of value.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The spell Ravenna's mother placed on her gave her the ability to steal youth and beauty, and indeed all things good, for her own evil purposes. But for every life there must be a death, for every gain, loss, and under the reign of Ravenna nature turned on itself and people turned on each other.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC V/O
dialogues.text: And all this time, she kept Snow White in a cell in the north tower. Ravenna, in the shadows, sits perfectly still. Though it' been years she looks the same. The object of her gaze is Snow White, who has changed. She is now a woman, lying in darkened cell. Asleep. Around the corner, Finn secretly eyes his sister, who doe notice him. Ravenna, just outside the cell, doesn't blink, entranced Snow White. Strange. Snow White opens her eyes and sees Ravenna. This is not t first time this has happened. Their eyes locked. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?... Ravenna doesn't answer, just stands and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chill wind whips through the woods. Lying sprawled on t ground we see a man (ERIC) who looks like he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only as we move closer to his rugged face that we se empty FLAGON OF GROG by his side and realize he's drunk. eyes flicker, as a WOMAN'S SCREAM cuts through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPECTRE OF A WOMAN
dialogues.text: SARA, beautiful, in pain. A patch of blood blossoms on he dress. Her mouth is open, screaming but no sound comes ou

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Eric's eyes flicker and begin to open -- then he hears it again.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Help!!!! He rises to his feet unsteadily, his head pounding from a hangover, then grabs two THROWING HATCHETS and slides the his harness on his back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric runs past trees and ducks under branches, crashing i few, still drunk. As he arrives at a clearing he sees a beautiful girl, (ROSE), fighting off a HUGE TATTOOED WARR (BROCH).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay a hand on her and I'll take your head! BROCH turns and sees the huntsman with his hatchet raised

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ale given you courage again, huntsman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't take much courage to split your skull from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, but first you'd have to see straight. Broch advances with a grin, drawing his own axe. Trying t his vision and steady his aim, Eric hurls the hatchet -- MISSES, the blade sticking in the tree above the frighten Greta's head -- Broch is on Eric in an instant, swinging his huge battle Eric narrowly avoids the deadly blows, his natural skill dexterity slowed down by all the ale he's drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks on, terrified, as Broch drives Eric towards th trees. He corners him against an oak and swings his axe - for Eric to duck at the last moment -- The blade buries itself deep in the tree, stuck. We reali from Eric's dark smile that he lured Broch into the trap. draws his second hatchet, but instead of using the blade, Broch over the head with the handle, knocking him out. Rose looks on in admiration as the huntsman goes through pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Eric turns. Rose sees how handsome he is. Eric stares at thoughtfully then approaches and gently lifts her chin, examining her pretty features. Rose doesn't seem to mind, looking back with an inviting smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to repay you? Eric stares at her a moment, then suddenly picks her up a tosses her over his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, somebody else will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see a RICKETY PRISON WAGON full of BEAUTIFUL G just like Rose, staring out furiously from behind bars. E a SLAVE MERCHANT haggle over Rose who is bound and gagged looking just as furious as the other women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her nose is on the large size and her chin's a little weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eyes are dim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you two gold pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all the business we've done together? Rose curses behind her gag as Eric pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four gold pieces and that's my final offer! Eric doesn't even bother to turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll peddle my wares elsewhere, thank you. The slave merchant sees his prize disappearing and calls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten gold pieces! Eric hesitates, but it's not from a guilty conscience, he considering the price. Then he smiles, turns. They have a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get our first good look at grown Snow White as she sha wood for a fire. She's done this every day for years. A regimen. Her hands work precisely as she stacks the wood blows on the kindling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 29a OMITTED 29a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is now burning and Snow White warms her hands on She hears APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS. Unusual. She jumps up ge in her bed and pretends to sleep. A GUARD opens a cell opposite Snow White. A few seconds later the door CLANGS SHUT. As soon as the Guard is gone, Snow White rises, walks to cell door and looks down the hall to the other cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... What's your name? Rose, sitting in a dark corner, goes to her cell bars and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Rose. Snow White smiles - a friendly face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna stands, attended by MAIDS, in a black gown, open front. Appropriate in private but not when -- Ravenna's GENERALS and Finn stand across from her. The Generals avert their eyes, made uncomfortable by her near nakedness. The General uses a pointer to make his presentation while another holds a map.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK KNIGHT GENERAL
dialogues.text: There are scattered rebel groups on the fringe of the dark forest, but they cause little harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dips her fingers into a bowl of DEAD SONGBIRDS, pluck out a tiny heart and eats it as she listens, not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what of the Duke?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK KNIGHT GENERAL
dialogues.text: We have pushed his forces into the mountains but his stronghold at Carmath  holds firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay siege to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mountains and fortress provide impenetrable protection, my Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then lure him out! Burn every village that supports him. Poison their wells. If they still resist put their heads on pikes to decorate the roads!

dialogues.speaker: BLACK KNIGHT GENERAL
dialogues.text: My Queen. (chooses words carefully) They have taken the fight to us. Rebels harry our supply lines and rob our pay wagons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have just captured two of the rebel leaders. They will be put to the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to interrogate them myself. She drops her robe and walks up the steps to her bath. Sh lowers herself into the white liquid. Her face disappears beneath the viscous liquid, then she rises, like a porcel statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 31a INT. BATHING CHAMBER - MOMENTS LATER 31a ECU - A small songbird, it's chest open, revealing a smal heart. Ravenna's claw plucks the tiny heart and we follow to her mouth. She is dressed now and stands at a window, Finn at her si OUTSIDE THE WINDOW - A CROWD OF STARVING PEASANTS at the of the castle, fight over the milk pouring from her bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't go back. She is lost for a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, do you remember when we were children, begging for scraps like those wretches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I not kinder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Snow White converse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the girls in our village were taken. I was trying to reach safe haven at Duke Hammond's castle when I was caught -- Snow White bursts with hope --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duke?! He's alive?! He still fights in my father's name?! Rose stares at the feral girl now, realizing who she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the king's daughter? Princess?... The night the evil one's reign began we were told all in the castle were put to the sword. How were you spared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William? What about William?! The Duke's son?! Is he alive?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, princess. Rose shakes her head, still gazing at Snow White, then he the distant cries of other female prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will they do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna sweeps into the great hall. The Generals and Finn snap to attention. She stops and st at TWO MEN, the captured insurgents. THOMAS, a grizzled old rebel, looks badly bruised and bea while his handsome son, LAIN, is unmarked. They both star her defiantly. Ravenna faces the two rebels. A SOLDIER steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Queen, these two were captured leading an ambush of our supply caravan. Ravenna seems intrigued, steps forward, eyeing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left your home, your family, the bosom of my protection, to aid my enemies? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because under your rule we have lost everything. We will not stop until this kingdom is free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son? She moves to Iain, right up to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously a debt owed to your wife. She reaches out and touches Iain's strong jaw. He struggl against the Guards that hold him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a time I would have lost my heart to a face like yours -- and you would have no doubt broken mine. In a flash Iain grabs a Guard's dagger and rams it into Ravenna's chest. She makes a pained face, looks down at t dagger, then up to Iain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would kill your Queen? She pulls the dagger out - there is no"wound, no blood - drops it on the ground. Iain and Thomas are shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (admiring; to Iain) You have beauty. And courage. But how strong is your heart? She smiles, almost regrettably, then places her hand on h chest. We hear HIS HEART START TO HAMMER -- LOUDER AND LO He grimaces in pain as she SQUEEZES -- the hammering fill ears -- until his heart finally bursts and he drops dead. Thomas falls to his knees in horror, trying to revive his Finn draws his sword to behead him when Ravenna raises he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Let him return to the Duke and speak of the generosity of his Queen. With that she sweeps out, followed by Finn. It's only now we see the lines on her face. Finn takes her by the arm a falters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Ravenna pulls her arm away furiously. The General and the others stare, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: OUT
dialogues.text: They quickly exit, all save Finn, who watches, concerned, Ravenna leans against the wall for support. She pulls herself together, looks at Finn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic comes at a lofty price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the expense grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: old?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My powers... fade. This is about as much as Ravenna can confess. Finn watche as she walks up the stairs to the mirror chamber. Then he turns and CLAPS HIS HANDS TWICE. A GUARD appears and Finn nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 33a INT. MIRROR CHAMBER - ROYAL PALACE 33a Ravenna walks into the room. Eyes the mirror, afraid to l at herself.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I have something for what ails you. She turns to see -- Finn, with Rose. Ravenna almost smiles. Rose holds her gaze defiantly. Ravenna walks over, admire her face, smiles, then takes her by the throat and -- LIFTS HER OFF HER FEET. Rose opens her mouth to scream bu instead of sound, ENERGY pours out. Ravenna opens her mou DEVOURING GRETA'S YOUTH AND BEAUTY. Like a flower bloomin her lines vanish. Like a flower wilting, Rose AGES until she's as old as the scullery maids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White hears approaching footsteps and watches as a G opens Greta's cell and tosses someone in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose?... The Guard clangs the cell door shut and walks away. Snow White peers through the shadows. Can't quite make he out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAVENNA stares into her mirror now, rejuvenated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirror, mirror, on the wall, Who is the fairest of them all? The bronze ripples. The Mirror Man pours out and reforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Queen, you have defied nature and robbed it of its fairest fruit. But on this day there is one more beautiful than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More beautiful, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is the reason your powers wane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't live to see tomorrow. Who is it?! Give me her name?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White. Ravenna is shocked by this, staggers a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn'.'. (back to mirror) I should have killed her as a child. She is my undoing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is also your treasure, Queen. It was wise to have kept her close for the innocence and purity that can destroy can also heal. Hold her heart in your hands and you shall never again need to consume youth. You shall never again weaken or age. Immortality without cost! Ravenna laughs, overjoyed. Finn appears out of the shadows. All he sees is his siste laughing, giddily into her mirror, no sign of the mirror as if it exists only in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Queen?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White paces in her cell, frantic. Two magpies appear in the window. She looks at them and watches as they flap their wings. Like they're trying to tell her something. She moves toward them. They jump back and up to the edge of the roof that is bes the cell window, hovering there. She is confused but notices -- A roofing nail, right where the Magpies hover. Snow White reaches a hand out the window and touches the loose nail. Her fingers move it back and forth as it, bit bit, breaks free. She yanks hard.at the nail, almost has it when -- The Magpies flutter again and blast away, as if afraid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White hears FOOTSTEPS down the hall. She steadies herself, yanks once, twice and the nail come loose. she jumps down, lies in her bed again just as -- Finn unlocks her door, leaving the key in the lock, and w into the cell. He stands there until she turns her head slightly to him. She doesn't move, grips the nail in her closed hand as sh tries to lure him closer with her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I wake you? Snow White shakes her head gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you always awake when I watch you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never come in before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Queen won't allow it. She wants you all to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He can't help himself, reaches out and touches her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, princess. You will never again be locked in a cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she want from me? His finger move from her hair to her cheek, stroking it gently, and then to her chest. With his free hand he reac back for his dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your beating heart. Snow White grips the roofing nail even tighter as she loo at him. As he leans closer, she notices his off hand - th dagger and -- She SLASHES him across the face with the nail. Blood flie Finn reacts, grabs his face in pain, yells and Snow White kicks him and runs for the door, locking it behind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White hurtles down the steps to Greta's cell. She is shocked by what she sees. Rose, now an old woman, looks t Snow White fumbles with the keys. Rose holds out both her hands. Snow White takes them, looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Finn stumbles to the cell door, clutching his face.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS
dialogues.text: Snow White tosses the keys into an empty cell and races a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White runs down the steps into a corridor and sees A GUARDS appear at the other end. She hurries into another bolting the door shut behind her, and charges down the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOW WHITE BURSTS OUTSIDE -- into the light. She almost hyperventilates at all the air, the sky. Then she runs th the courtyard toward the portcullis. The magpies fly right into her face then away, telling he follow. She does and heads straight for the small opening the base of the castle wall - the entrance to the SEWERS. As the magpies rise, she slides on one hip, plunging into darkness below. The guards follow but can't squeeze throu the opening, running towards the Portcullis instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White splashes through the deep stinking sludge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old rebel, Thomas, with his son's body draped over a looks back curiously as he hears the guards yelling --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF GUARD 0/S
dialogues.text: Open the gates! The Princess has escaped! He stares in surprise as riders gallop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White is swept out of the sewers into the sea. Seawe wraps itself around her limbs, pulling her deeper.into th depths, but she kicks and fights her way back to the surf gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White swims ashore. She looks up and sees a maze of rocks stretching out. She sets off in one direction when MAGPIES reappear, urging her to follow them in another direction. She scrambles after them and sees a WHITE MARE waiting for her on the beach, lying on its side, allowing climb on. The mare raises itself and is away in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galloping hooves skim the surf, RIDERS pursuing Snow Whit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White rides towards the village -- only it's unrecog now -- most of the cottages have been razed to the ground boarded up. A group of people including children - skeletal, hungry, desperate - see her approach and move out to greet her. She stops her horse for a moment, gazing past tears at th devastation and the state of villagers all around her. At first their approach seems harmless but as they get cl their faces reveal dangerous desperation and -- She gallops off, looking back to see the Queen's men givi chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fields and woods are even more devastated than the vi Farmland has been burnt to cinders and trees chopped down around Snow White the world is stubble and ash.

dialogues.speaker: DAY. 49
dialogues.text: Snow White crests a hill, her mare rearing as she sees -- DARK FOREST -- A VAST WALL OF PRIMORDIAL TREES. A mist se from the forest like an evil miasma. Snow white hesitates then sees the riders closing in and urges her mare on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadows everywhere. The mare charges into the misty bog t suddenly loses her footing. She rears -- throwing Snow Wh onto the safety of solid ground. Snow White tries to grab her reins but the horse pulls aw wanting to endanger her life. She tries again but the hor backs farther away from her. Slowly they're separated by swirling fog -- As Snow White sees the silhouettes of the riders reappear Reluctantly she turns and runs into the forest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The riders are about to follow when their horses rear and in terror. One guard is thrown off and sucked down in the frightening off the others. Despite their concern for Snow White, the MAGPIES are als afraid to enter the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White hurtles through the trees, a ghostly fog risin all around her, then trips over a root, landing face firs A patch of LARGE MUSHROOMS that unleash CLOUDS OF POLLEN. coughs, trying to fan the pollen away, but it's too late. hurries on, but the hallucinations come thick and fast no The trees look almost human, hooded figures peering at he through the haze. She sees owls without eyes. Black oil o out of tree trunks. A hanging vine reaches down and touch like a hand and now she runs -- More terrors rage at her from the swirling mist. She stum again and when she looks up vampire bats scream at her fr trees. Huge skeletal forms crack out of the bark, descend her until she finally passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above, we see the unconscious Snow White as mis whirls in a circle. 52a EXT. CASTLE BEACH - NIGHT.(D4N) 52a Vicious waves crash into rocks. Nature's anger on display

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From above we see Ravenna striding furiously in a circle her own. She is livid, a whirling dervish. She's fairly spitting as she barks at Finn, who stands in middle of the room, his face bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it an innocent young girl makes a fool of my brother?! Armed only with a nail?! If she'd had a sword she'd have taken the whole castle! We're in front of her, behind her, on her face, on her fe She picks up the pace as well as the volume --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You swore to protect me! Do you not understand what, the girl means to us?! This is my future! This is everything. Everything! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no one I can trust in this place!! There is no loyalty! None!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she stops on a dime, turns to him, marches right Finn and -- BELTS HIM! Hard. He staggers a bit then picks himself up, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was chased into the dark forest. She's likely already dead. She SCREAMS and slaps him viciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's no good to me there, lost. I must have her heart! You have failed me! Finn's had enough, he erupts at her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I not given all to you?! She takes this, softens, unexpectedly, and almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I not given you all? All. She raises her finger and touches his face. His wound hea instantly and his face grows calm. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, my Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fail me again, Finn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no powers in the Dark Forest. Bring me someone who knows it well. Someone who can hunt her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53a OMITTED 53a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn speaks to a group of people assembled by his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen demands the services of someone to navigate the Dark Forest. The villagers stay mum, shaking their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-one goes into the Dark Forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be compensated. Still no takers. An OLD-TIMER stares right at FINN, steps forwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one man. A widower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where might I find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Inn. Drinking. THE SOUND OF SMASHING WOOD. They turn to see -- Eric flies through the Inn's wall and lands in a heap on ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appears he's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric. Drunk. He tries to focus as Broch strides through t same hole and stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me money from my pocket and money for the girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have it right here in my pocket. If you'll just help me up. Eric holds his hand out. Broch walks over, suspicious. Wh he's close, Eric grabs his arm and kicks with both feet i Broch's chest. Broch flies back, then strides to Eric and kicks him in the side. Hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I seem to have drunk it all. You're welcome to it when it comes out again. Broch hauls him back up to his feet. He takes a swing but somehow the drunken Eric dodges the blow, swinging back a him. Everyone has come out of the Inn to enjoy the fight. Eric lands a body blow to Broch, who doubles over. Eric comes in for the kill, winds up and swings - Missing Broch but hitting a HORSE on the ass. It kicks it legs, sending him flying. He lands in a heap and drops hi head back. Hands lift him and -- Drop him in a horse trough. He's underwater for a few seconds before he comes to and lifts out his head, eyes s closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfume? He opens his eyes to see Finn gazing down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royalty. That explains it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen demands your presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see I'm having a bath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAVENS perch on the ledges and LURCHERS scamper about. Eric, still drunk, filthy, damp clothes, face bruised, en the room, eyes the ravens, then looks at -- Ravenna on her throne. She watches him curiously. He's mo interested in the aged scullery maids, including Rose, wh staring at him accusingly. He has no idea who they are or he's done wrong. Finally he comes before the Queen, sizin up like a tavern beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother tells me you are a widower, a drunkard and one of few who has ventured into the dark forest. Finn looks on, standing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my prisoners has escaped there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he's dead -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She. She shoots Finn a pointed look then looks back at Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she is certainly dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find her. Bring her to me. Eric holds her gaze, uneasy at the request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been to the Dark Forest enough times to know I'm not going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be rewarded handsomely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coin's no good to me if I'm lying dead with crows picking at my eyes. Ravenna steps off her throne now, approaching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There may be more than gold in the offing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is her life of such value?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is none of your concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll determine what concerns me, thank you. She smiles, moves even closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will do this for me, Huntsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I refuse? Ravenna nods to the Guards, who pull their swords. Dying cut him to pieces. Eric eyes them, then looks to her and, complete honesty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me the favor. I beg of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you wish to be reunited with your beloved? Eric reacts instinctively, grabbing her by the throat. Th courtiers rise to their feet and the guards draw their swords, but Ravenna holds up her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife is none of your concern. Something about her face, the fact that she enjoys his ha on her throat makes Eric queasy. He releases his grip, stares right at Ravenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My condolences. Ravenna holds his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss her? His eyes say, yes, he misses her horribly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you give to bring her back? Eric stares at her curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know of my powers. Bring me the girl and I will bring back your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing will bring her back. Ravenna moves even closer, looks him right in the eye. Sh is incredibly persuasive as she says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can. Believe me, huntsman. Eric's eyes say he wants to believe. Needs to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A life for a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mist drifts across the moors, the primordial trees loomin ahead. Finn and Eric ride side by side, FOUR GUARDS follo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fought in the west? Against the armies of the five kings? Eric nods without looking at him, gazing at the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have seen a great deal of death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now, you're being modest. There is a difference between gutting a deer and gutting a man. How many did you kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not something I counted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Nor I. But I recall every face. There is no greater delight than battle. Eric finds this unseemly, but prefers not to engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now, huntsman, what do you feel when you watch a man die? Delight? Invincibility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrow. This takes Finn aback, not an answer he was expecting. Af a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what of them? At the tip of your sword. What do they feel? I'd enjoy knowing. Eric looks at him, realizing from Finn's face that it is honest question. -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The.only difference between you and I is I'-never found a wife to save my soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. You'll need one. He stops his horse and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all stopped at the entrance to the Dark Forest f meters ahead. The Guards gulp back their fears. Finn trie to hide his own. Even the horses sense danger and start to whinny and back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vines and roots have grown over Snow White's body, as if forest is trying to devour her. She opens her eyes, sees wrists and ankles bound and reacts in horror, struggling herself of her bonds. WE PULL UP, UP, UP until we can see the full scope of the Dark Forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Finn have tethered their nervous horses and stan the entrance to the bog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do exactly as I do. Eric carefully places one foot after the next on grassy s stones that disappear into the bog as soon as his full we on them. The others catch on and follow, stepping on ston their own. Once they're across the bog and onto dry land Finn takes step forward but Eric grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly as I do. Eric puts a cloth to his face, gesturing for Finn and his to do the same and moves forward through the mushroom fie pops of pollen misting all around them. Eric stops, bends down, spotting faint FOOTPRINTS in the walks faster now, Finn watching in admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White finally shakes free of the vines, jumps up and she's being followed. She looks up at the trees but all s are vague shadows. The wind picks up, ghostly voices howl the breeze. She's rooted to the spot for a moment, then l her nerve and runs -- 64aEXT. DARK FOREST - DAY. 64a Eric, Finn and the Guards move through a dark copse of tr VOICES AND WHISPERS-call to them from the wind. Eric stop looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 64a CONTINUED: 64a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay them no mind. One of the Guards leans over a pool of water to drink whe sees a GHOSTLY REFLECTION gazing back at him. He stares i surprise, leaning closer. Suddenly a BARBED TAIL shoots o of the water -- skewering him -- and drags him into the depths. The others turn as they hear a scream but there's no sign their companion now, just the bubbling water. Only Finn looks unconcerned. Eric stops senses something, holds up a hand. Then darts ahead, leaving them flat-footed. Finn makes a decision to follow and waves for his Guards to go ahead o him. They reluctantly follow Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric moves quickly then stops, listens - we see his hunti skills - as he hears the noise of cracking branches in th distance, he blasts away, moving like lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White feels like the whole forest is pursuing her. R out of breath, she hides in some bushes. As she stares in mist, she sees a sinister figure appear through the haze. Eric stops and looks around, sensing his prey is close. S White stays low, trying to quieten her breathing. Eric studies the forest floor. He sees Snow White's footp then looks up at an area of disturbed undergrowth. Snow White peers through the bushes and sees the huntsman boots approaching. She looks around for something to defe herself with when the sound of the footsteps fades. She c see anyone now. She looks relieved when SUDDENLY STRONG H GRAB HER BY THE FEET AND DRAG HER OUT OF THE BUSHES. She fights to get away but he pins her with a foot, reach down and turns her over. His first look at her gives him pause. Her face, her spir her youth. She slaps at him - he pulls out his knife with one hand while he pins her with the other. Then grabs, lifts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bites him. He grimaces and grabs her tighter and star trudging back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to kill me! The Oueen! He ignores, keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me! Her brother tried to cut out my heart. He stops, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear it. He somehow believes her. New game. Then...

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Quick work! Eric looks up to see Finn and his men approaching. Snow W gasps at the sight of Finn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him! He's the one! He came at me with a knife! Eric holds her tight, one arm around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, huntsman. Hand her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't trust him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you intend to do with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you care? Finn nods and the Guards approach. Eric grips her tighter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want her. Give me what I was promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now huntsman, you did your job well. Keep your word and hand her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll betray you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill us both -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, shut up! He puts his knife to her throat to quiet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep my word when the Queen keeps hers. Finn shakes his head and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a drunk and a fool. My Queen has many powers; she can take life or sustain it. But she can't bring your wife back from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: I WANT HER BACK
dialogues.text: His face tells us how much Eric wanted, needed to believe The Guards keep inching toward Eric. Eric, still with a knife to Snow White's throat, starts slowly backing up. Finn pulls his own sword and approaches. Four against one. As they burst toward him he tosses Snow White to the ground and in the same motion throws his kni into the chest of one of the Guards, who crumbles. Eric reaches behind, grabs both hatchets and faces off wi the others. They all rush at once. Eric fights off the guards as he raises a hatchet, throws it -- Right into Finn's chest. Just like Ravenna, no blood, no wound. Finn pulls it out, laughs and throws it at the huntsman who ducks as it sticks into a tree. Snow White, terrified, races off into the forest. They notice her exit but keep fighting. Eric fights on three sides now - holding his own until Fi manages to plunge a sword in his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric grunts and falls back. Finn races forward to finish off but Eric lunges and -- Flips Finn onto his back and into a grove of mushrooms. Eric covers his nose with his arm and looks at the other Guards, who look from Finn, who is dazed, to Eric, who is hurt. Finn struggles to his knees, shakes his head, hallucinati bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butcher him! Find her! The Guards, also trying to cover their noses, move forwar Eric has a decision to make. Bad odds. And he's injured. Eric decides in an instant, grabs his knife out of the dead Guard, as well as his hat from the tree and runs after Snow White --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White crashes through the woods. Then a HAND grabs her shoulder-- Eric. He slaps a palm over her mouth before she can screa and slides down a steep slope into undergrowth. 67a EXT. DARK FOREST - FINN - SAME 67a Finn is on his feet but still hallucinating - stumbling about. The Guards are spooked as they look all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not finished! The words echo through the dark forest. 67b EXT. DARK FOREST - ERIC AND SNOW WHITE - SAME 67b Eric removes his hand from Snow White's mouth. At once she PUNCHES HIM WITH ALL SHE'S GOT. He steps back, licks his bloody lip. She takes another sw This one he manages to grab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off me. She draws his dagger. He backs off. Eyeball to eyeball:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 67b CONTINUED: 67b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does the Queen want you dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants us all dead. All of us-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what makes you so damn valuable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know. You're the one hunting me. He backs away. Paces.

dialogues.speaker: 36A
dialogues.text: 67b CONTINUED: (2) 67b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never get involved in the Queen's business and what do I do? Get involved in the Queen's business... Without warning, he walks off. Leaving her alone. She follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from you, love. You're trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get to the Duke's Castle. There's an army there. I'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duke? I've seen sheep with more fight in them. Desperate, she takes a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me, you'll be rewarded. I'm valuable. Isn't that why you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead if you return without me. And I'm dead if you leave me. He turns, exasperated with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Then -- wearily:) Just for argument's sake. (Shakes his head) How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is enough? Eric "reluctantly" prices up the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well,it's a long way, through the forest, and that... that's a dangerous road, I couldn't even consider it for less than thirty gold pieces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred. Deliver me safe to the Duke. I give you my word.

dialogues.speaker: 36B
dialogues.text: 67b CONTINUED: (3) 67b Deep quandary. Still suspicious..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? She looks at him levelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's a question you should have asked the queen. Stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have a deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust you Billy Goat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given you my word. He spits on his hand. She puts out her hand. He shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust you either. She wipes it on her skirt. Behind them, a commotion. They run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67c OMITTED 67c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68a EXT. DARK FOREST - DAY. 68a Tree roots gleam with an eerie phosphorescent light. The closes in. Snow White looks around the forest, unnerved b the haunting silence and the deep shadows. Reluctantly sh focuses on Eric, trying to take her mind off the terrors around her. He sits on a log for a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stay the night here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't answered me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't recall a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going? He takes a stick, draws in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen. Mountains. Dark Forest. Here. Past. There's a village. She takes the stick, points to a different spot in the di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the Duke's Castle. He grabs the stick back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll go where I take you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll take me to the Duke's castle or I'll go alone.

dialogues.speaker: 37A
dialogues.text: 68a CONTINUED: 68a SNOW WHITE (cont'd) (beat; looks around) As soon as you get me out of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're rather demanding, and not all that endearing, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 68a CONTINUED: (2) 68a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reward that awaits you. There are noblemen there, an army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An army? The Duke fights? He hides behind walls. I know sheep that have more fight in them. (after a beat) How much? (off her look) Reward? Just for argument's sake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you want? Eric considers this, not sure how or if to negotiate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred gold pieces. Do we have a deal? More, a lot more, than he was expecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll deliver you to safety m' lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear (beat). Constantly. It's one of my better qualities. She's not sure what to make of this, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. He moves to a spot to lie down and gathers leaves. Snow White seeks her own spot and comes upon -- the RIB C OF A DEAD DEER, a host of BEAUTIFUL BUTTERFLIES feeding o its bones. She is shocked. Eric notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen far stranger things in here. She sits, looks to Eric. Something's been bothering her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think... will they follow us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd be foolish to. Few survive. Good news/bad news. She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 68a CONTINUED: (3) 68a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far have you travelled into the Dark Forest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We passed it a few miles back. He opens his flask and takes a healthy pull.

dialogues.speaker: DAY. 69
dialogues.text: We're moving over high mountains and valleys now, approac Duke Hammond's castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grim faced COMMANDERS look on as DUKE HAMMOND comforts a sobbing man in the firelight. We recognise the old rebel, THOMAS, whose son was killed by Ravenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She killed brave Lain with only her palm and pulled a dagger from her chest without blood. She cannot be killed. Duke Hammond has heard enough, turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The princess has escaped the castle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAMING MOSS is thrown into a puddle of oil and a MASSIVE FIRE lights up the night. William, rapid-fires his bow at close quarters into a lin the Queen's supply wagons and the fight is on. A VIOLENT CLASH OF SWORDS IN CLOSE QUARTER FIGHTING. His COMPANIONS are as wild and hot-headed as he is, roari with delight as the Queen's men finally flee.

dialogues.speaker: 72-7 30MITTED 72-73
dialogues.text: 73a INT. WAR ROOM/ DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE - NIGHT. 73a William enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked for me, father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 73a CONTINUED: 73a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have news of the Princess. William stares in surprise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna has kept her all these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She escaped the castle and into the dark

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going after her!.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know if she survived -- Duke Hammond grabs him by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ventured beyond the walls tonight, disobeying my orders. We are all that's left, William. I cannot afford to lose any more of my men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will go alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I cannot afford to lose my only heir! You do not know the dark forest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll find someone who does. William pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not abandon her a second time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William gallops away from the castle walls under the cove the breaking dawn. 75 MOVED TO 68a 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A motley crew of woodsmen stand side to side. Finn is eye them, sizing them up, picking a crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which of you knows the dark forest? A powerfully built Yakut tracker, ALDAN, and BROCH both n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. You. You. You. He's selected Aldan, Broch and points to others. As we mo down the line we see -- William, hat low, trying to look tough. Finn selects a few more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load and prepare. You ride for bounty. Into the dark forest. The rest of you. Away ! As they disperse.. William sets his jaw, and heads off..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men ride out of the village. Suddenly they stop. Standing up ahead is William, blocking their path. He cal to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a bowman? FINN calls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a bowman. Away. WILLIAM stands unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said away, damn you! WILLIAM doesn't move. Finn turns to the bowman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowman smiles, draws his bow. BEFORE he can loose an arrow:

dialogues.speaker: THWACK
dialogues.text: Two arrows strike the bowman in the throat, lifting him o his horse, stone dead. FINN turns. WILLIAM lowers his bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said do you need a bowman? Finn studies William with dead eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80aEXT. VILLAGE ROAD - DAY. 80a In the pouring rain, a group of fierce BOUNTY HUNTERS rid horseback, when another rider appears, blocking their way It's William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 80a CONTINUED: 80a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear the road. But William doesn't budge. One of the other mercenaries grins, then rides towards William, drawing his sword. He raises it when William unslings his bow and loosens two arrows at close range, hitting him in each thigh and knocking him off his horse. Broch draws his enormous battle axe, about to charge, whe Finn rides forward and stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Finn sizes up William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quick with a bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to ride with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are paying well and I need the coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you traversed the Dark Forest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what use are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you said, I'm quick with a bow. He nods to the guy on the ground, groaning with arrows in thighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And unlike him, I have two good legs. Finn considers for a moment, then smiles, nods to the guy the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Replace him. William looks at Finn gratefully. Finn studies him with a curious smile then rides on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above, we see the dark forest stretching out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83a EXT. DARK FOREST - DAY 83a Snow White approaches a stream, kneels, splashes her face brings a handful of water to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that if I were you. Not unless you want your bowels to rip apart. She turns. Eric has been snoozing on a rock, with one eye open. She releases the water, stands and faces off with E who offers his flask of mead. She reluctantly takes a sip spits most of it out, hands it back. He smells something, walks a few steps, bends down and ex a long brown pellet shaped object on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fumee.

dialogues.speaker: 44A
dialogues.text: 83a CONTINUED: 83a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to call it by another name? He doesn't need to. It's an animal dropping. Snow White w as he kneads it between his fingers and takes a long snif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 83a CONTINUED: (2) 83a She catches the look of fear in his eyes as he gazes arou woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. He moves away, though the trees, tracking prey. He hears wind call his name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric. He stops, looks to -- An outcropping of rocks, surrounded by dense forest. From out behind a tree steps an apparition of SARA. She's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara?...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SNOW WHITE
dialogues.text: She hears him call out and follows his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HUNTSMAN
dialogues.text: Sara holds out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I dreaming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touch me and see for yourself. Eric shakes his head, looks around, tries to fight it, bu Her face draws him back and he begins to walk toward the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't there to save me, Eric. I called for you but you never came. Snow White appears behind and sees -- Eric is walking toward a dark area where several sets of lupine eyes await. But Eric only sees Sara and he continues to move toward h She opens her arms to him and steps backwards, luring him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you, Eric? Come to me now. Protect me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 83a CONTINUED: (3) 83a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, I'm so sorry. Forgive me, please forgive me. Give me peace. Sara... He takes another step toward her and -- Buckles - THWACK! Snow White hits him behind his knees with a piece of wood He hits the ground and she drags him away. He fights back she jumps on top of him, staring right into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not real! Not real! Do you hear me?! He does and calms. She gets off him and he sits up, fatig by the experience. A low point for him. He reaches for his flask -- pours the last single drop in his mouth. All gone. He tosses it aside. A lost soul. Snow White watches him with some compassion. He catches h look, gets up and walks away. 83b EXT. DARK FOREST OPEN AREA - DAY 83b Snow White catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she? The one you bargained for. The one that spoke to you. Who is Sara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A name you'll not mention again. He tosses a knife to her. She's surprised but catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel its weight. One hand to the other. She shakes her head but does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hold it - business end pointed at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you?-- He lunges at her and she raises the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is your lead foot?

dialogues.speaker: 46A
dialogues.text: 83b CONTINUED: 83b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 83b CONTINUED: (2) 83b He jumps at her again and she puts her right foot forward knife in right hand pointed. He starts to slowly move tow her. One step at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now stay back. You're too small to attack. You have to parry; use your opponents strength against him. Raise your opposing forearm. She does. He comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With it you block and deflect an opposing thrust. You'll lose meat but you won't die from it. Wait until I'm close. He steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Watch my hands, not my eyes. He moves even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Not until you can feel my breath. He moves right up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. Their faces are inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This close. Drive it through me. To the hilt. Now look in my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pull it out 'til you see my soul. Their eyes are still locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I need to learn how to kill? He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot you need to learn lass. Eric backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that. She nods, now-focused on him in a way other than as an instructor. He turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 83b CONTINUED: (3) 83b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fumee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single blossom flowers on the dying apple tree. Ravenna looking weaker than before, stares at it quietly, as if s were gazing at Snow White. She reaches out and crushes th blossom in her hand, turning it into ash. Her look is one of conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn reacts as if he heard Ravenna's words. He did. They that kind of connection. Spooked, he continues on. The ot trackers follow, William looking tense. At the back of th group, one of the mercenaries slows down, sensing somethi the forest. William is still watching Finn when they hear a bloodcurd CRY behind them. The mercenary's horse gallops out of the without its rider, a gaping wound in its side. William an others look shaken but Finn doesn't even turn around, rid 87a EXT. DARK FOREST - DAY. 87a Eric pulls Snow White along. Beyond a bridge we see open -- the bridge LEADS OUT OF THE DARK FOREST -- and birds circling on the distant horizon. Snow White looks relieved as she follows him down a slope They hurry through a sea of mist when suddenly Eric stops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be this easy. He quietly unsheathes a hatchet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the end of the Dark Forest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not paying attention) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 87a CONTINUED: 87a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far to the Duke's castle? He ignores, follows tracks, then stops as he sees the STO BRIDGE below -- LEADING OUT OF THE DARK FOREST. Snow Whit stares at it too, relieved. Beyond the bridge there are o fens. They hurry down together and start to cross the bridge. They're half way across WHEN SUDDENLY WE SEE THE STONES S

dialogues.speaker: STARTS TO RISE --
dialogues.text: Snow White turns to see -- A HUGE CREATURE REARING UP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troll! Eric and Snow White are SLAMMED off the bridge and land i the shallow creek below -- among the CARCASSES OF SLAIN ANIMALS.
