The troll roars and comes after them, swinging i giant stone fists. Eric grabs Snow White and runs -- As the troll catches up with them, Eric shoves her out of way and draws his hatchets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! Snow White turns and flees. Eric runs at the Troll. He du as a mighty arm sweeps over him, darts between the troll' legs, and hacks at its leg with his hatchets. The Troll falters a bit then -- A swinging stone fist catches him and hurls him across th creek. Snow White looks back to see Eric lying stunned on the ground, his wound bleeding again, at the troll's mercy. S hesitates, still terrified, then runs back. The Troll towers over the huntsman. It raises its stone h to crush him when -- Snow White arrives -- SCREAMING LIKE A BANSHEE! The Troll looks around in surprise. So does Eric. A beat, then the monster turns away from Eric, striding towards S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands her ground, fighting her terror, PULLS HER KNI The TROLL looms over her, but she doesn't retreat. She ra an arm, just as Eric instructed.

dialogues.speaker: 49A
dialogues.text: 87a CONTINUED: (2) 87a Eric stares in surprise, watching the twenty foot monster towering over the tiny girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 87a CONTINUED: (3) 87a Snow White stares into the troll's eyes, seeing something almost gentle in its monstrous gaze, slowly losing her fe The troll stares at her too, confused, then slowly pacifi until it finally turns and strides away. Eric stares in disbelief. Snow White is rooted to the spo also confused but strangely moved by what's happened. Eri rises to his feet painfully and heads over, taking her by arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had you'd be dead. A "thank you" would suffice. It's clear he sees her in a different light. She stares b at him. Eric holds her gaze, struggling a bit, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun glints through the thinning trees. Eric wades thr the deep sludge, Snow White following in his steps. Eric looks at her a moment, then suddenly turns away as h sees her expression change -- GHOSTLY BACKLIT FIGURES EMERGE on the banks of the marsh holding bows and arrows. Eric looks around for an escape but everywhere he turns MORE FIGURES APPEAR. He draws his axe when A FIGURE IN A HOODED CLOAK (ANNA) a clutching her bow like a goddess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say only demons or spirits can survive the dark forest. Which are you? Eric, unsure, pulls his hatchet and steps in front of Sno White protecting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither. Perhaps you are the Queen's spies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fugitives from the Queen. Snow White steps forward into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We mean you no harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna sees Snow White clearly now, raises her hood. Snow White sees a deep scar running down her otherwise beautif face. And then a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fenland village is made up of mud huts, elevated on s to protect them from flooding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone. Anna paddles a boat as they approach the village. Eric an Snow White speak quietly.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BANK
dialogues.text: The boat stops and they get out. The women of the village move from their hut to greet them as they walk into the village. More women emerge from their huts to view the newcomers, men in sight. They all have scarred faces. All the women have assembled alongside the group, watchin with awe as they pass. They stare at Snow White and murmu They can't take their eyes off her. Some even reach out t touch her sleeve or dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto; to Eric) Why are they looking at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but keep smiling. A beautiful LITTLE GIRL, LILY, moves away from her friend and offers her hand. Snow White stops, looks down at the girl, trying not to stare at her scar. 90-93a OMITTED 90-93a 93b EXT. BANKS OF THE LAKE/ FENLAND VILLAGE - DAY. 93b Eric sits by the lake, ANNA bandaging his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have travelled far Huntsman. With a heavy burden. Snow white is playing with Lily. They are making little d from straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had worse jobs. And anyway, she's not that heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean... you do not know who she is? His eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? He looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52aA 93b CONTINUED: 93b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE WAY
dialogues.text: Snow White draws eyes upon the doll. Snow White's eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father showed me how to make them. But he's gone away. Lily takes a stick and marks the dolls face with a scar..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. She's finished. She hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: 52A
dialogues.text: 93b CONTINUED: (2) 93b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful. Lily smiles and runs off to play. Behind her Eric appears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These women... This place.. It's very peaceful. But it makes me very sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me? She stops. She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'd think it too fell a task? You'd be right. She looks at him. Shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not why. It's because I've never said the words. She looks at Lily playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I believe it myself. I never felt like a.. (She stops.) Alone in a dark cell. For years. Fighting to cling to memories. What he looked like. Smelled like. The kind man with the big arms and the wonderful smiles.. To me.. he wasn't The King. He was my father. Eric doesn't know what to say. In time, he reaches in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've carried it a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it made of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gristle from a stag's heart. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: 52B
dialogues.text: 93b CONTINUED: (3) 93b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stag's the most timid animal in the forest but there's a bone in it's heart that gives it courage in it's hour of need and makes it the bravest in of all God's creatures. It's a protection charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or so they say. They share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it hers? It's the most honest and emotional he's been with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, huntsman. He looks at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting dark. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 93b CONTINUED: (4) 93b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White lies in her bed. Nearby sleep Anna and Lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not a kind thing to say in these times. Youth one cannot alter... beauty, however. We have sacrificed beauty to raise our children in peace. And you, your sacrifice will come, princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White looks to Anna, surprised. a95 EXT. OUTSIDE THE HUT - SAME a95 Eric exits and pauses, looks back - through the flap can Snow White. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 95a OMITTED 95a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96a OMITTED 96a 96b INT. INSIDE THE HUT - SAME. 96b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must prepare yourself, my dear. For a time soon comes when you must deliver that sacrifice. Will you be ready? Anna suddenly stops. As if something has disturbed her. S gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep my dear. You must rest. She leaves. 96c EXT. FENLAND VILLAGE. NIGHT. 96c Eric makes his way along the perimeter, finding a path through the trees. Suddenly he stops. Turns. Twenty feet away. It's Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you desert her now you know the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye I know the truth. And that's exactly why she should be as far from me as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the only one that can save us. She needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. I'm the last thing she needs. I'm bad luck. Everything I've ever cared about was destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's good in you Huntsman. I can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People have made that mistake before. He heads off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97a OMITTED 97a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White awakens. Looks around, no Eric, puts it in her pocket. Then smells smoke, walks outside and looks up to The sky BLAZES WITH BURNING ARROWS all raining down on th village. 104a EXT. WOODS - SAME - NIGHT. 104a Eric, moving away from the village, spins to see the ARRO LIGHTING UP THE SKY BEHIND HIM. He races toward the villa 104b-107 OMITTED 104b-107

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White re-enters the hut just as A FLAMING ARROW pier through the thatch and sticks next to Lily's sleeping hea Snow White pushes Lily away from the fire and grabs the arrow. Anna SCREAMS because - A MERCENARY races into the hut. On impulse Snow White backhand STABS HIM in the leg WITH FLAMING ARROW and he tumbles, flames burning his clothes. Snow White stares at him for a moment, his face, his pain Anna shakes her out of the moment and they all race out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn and his hunters scour the inferno on their horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, rats, run. Find her! William looks around the burning village in panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: llla OMITTED llla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White runs with Lily and Anna when she sees a FEARSO MERCENARY leap off his horse and stride towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! Snow White faces off with the Mercenary. She does as she' taught - waits for him to approach. When he's close enoug grab her slashes at him with the knife. The huge mercenar knocks her to the ground and advances on her. -- when an arrow strikes him in the shoulder. He falls, revealing a young warrior holding a bow. It's WILLIAM. Snow White stares at him through the flames a mixture of recognition and uncertainty. It's as if for a moment everything stops as she comes

dialogues.speaker: FACE TO FACE
dialogues.text: With something from the past. Almost like a ghost. Or a vision.. He nods to her in recognition. She stands perfectly still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna pulls Snow White away, as they move through the smok and the fire. William starts to follow, a curtain of smoke swirling aro him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric arrives to see the village in flames. He rushes to t centre of the village, pulling a mercenary off his horse running him through with his own sword, then fighting and killing TWO MORE MERCS as he makes his way forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55aA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn sits astride his horse like a demon king in the fire He spots William in the distance, searching for Snow Whit rides toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White looks back through the distant flames as she r when suddenly powerful arms grab her. She flails with the but it's only Eric --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must help them! Anna sees Snow White fighting off Eric and shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will! Go! Eric holds her firmly, pulling her away against her will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William jumps on his horse again, looking for Snow White the clouds of billowing smoke. Finn and Aldan ride up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my lord. Finn spits fury and continues to race around, frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric pulls Snow White onwards, the blazing fires from the village lighting up the marsh. He sees a lake up ahead wh figure appears, blocking their way. It's the giant BROCH. Grinning, he unstraps his huge axe, ready to face Eric on time. Eric doesn't even slow down, letting go of Snow Whi unstrapping his own hatchets. It looks as if it's going t epic fight, but as Broch swings, Eric ducks and drives bo hatchets into the giant's ribs, killing him instantly. They escape into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna walks up the spiral staircase. She passes an old woman who glances at her. She walks past a few steps, thi she hears a whisper, then turns on a heel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say? Then she's right in her face --

dialogues.speaker: WHAT DID YOU SAY
dialogues.text: The "old woman" just stares at her, shakes her head. Ther something in the woman's eyes that terrifies Ravenna. She backs up, retreating, then scurries away.

dialogues.speaker: 118C INT.ANTE ROOM
dialogues.text: Ravenna sits alone, naked. Her spine stretches through he taut skin.  In front of her sits the CROWN on a dark cushion, a matte tuft of HAIR caught on the gilded edge. She stares at it, then slowly raises her hand to a bald patch at the side o her hair.

dialogues.speaker: FINN
dialogues.text: The word echoes in the palace --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, surrounded by smoke and fire, is beyond frustration He screams to the heavens in despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Snow White are far down river. They make their w the bank, drenched and exhausted. Snow White's hands shak distraught over the violence at the village. Eric looks a guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I led them there. I am to blame. Snow White looks at him with empathy. He's in pain, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take you to Duke Hammond's. Snow White slowly nods. Eric lies back and looks up at the sun flickering through trees. It dances on his face and then -- A HUGE SHADOW blots out the light. Before he can react, fists and boots lay into him. As he protects his face, we catch glimpses of brutal figures in battle masks. Eric kicks a couple of them away, but more them swarm over him, pinning him down in leg locks and ch holds. Snow White is treated just as roughly, powerful arms and pinning her down. She bites one of her captors and he twi her arms behind her back. A noose is slung around Eric's ankles and he's hauled up - hanging upside down. Snow Whi also tied up, sits on the ground beside him. A line of DWARVES stand before them and pull up their grotesque BATTLE MASKS. The dwarf leader, Beith glowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, well... the miscreant huntsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Beith! Is this how you treat a friend? The dwarf leader, BEITH, glowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you horn beast, this is how I treat a friend! He smacks Eric with a gnarled stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124a EXT. WOODS - LATER - DAY. 124a Snow White and the huntsman are still trussed up like chi now. The dwarves are grouped together, arguing and occasi throwing angry glances toward Eric. As they bicker the dw slap and bite at each other - like animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 124a CONTINUED: 124a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to collect the bounty on their heads. A few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there no one you haven't wronged? Eric nods at her. "You."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's always tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it, you hedge pig. The Dwarf confab breaks up and they approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my lucky day, the puttock I loathe most in the world lands in my lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is your lucky day, Beith. I've got enough gold to keep you in ale for a year. Cut me down and I'll -- NION, Beith's right hand man and a fervent dwarf supremac clips Eric around the ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your ugly mug, huntsman. You had any pennies they would have fallen out your pockets by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hidden. Back there, in the woods. A short distance. They get the reference, don't like it. Nion slaps Eric ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull the other one, you lying dangler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them the truth, huntsman. The youngest of the dwarves, GUS, is beaming at Snow Whit his dirty teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: 59A
dialogues.text: 124a CONTINUED: (2) 124a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Miss. It's just... you been the prettiest thing I ever did seen. He smiles, almost sweetly, disarming her. Snow White look her other captors now, noticing a blind dwarf, (MUIR), wh with his son (QUERT), also gazing at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 124a CONTINUED: (3) 124a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me what I've done wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what you've done right first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved this girl from the Queen. Out of the goodness of my heart. Snow White gives him a look. He calms her with a look of own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't sound like you, huntsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, not ruttish swine. Nion gives Eric another smack around the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quert? Quert jumps to and helps his father as he makes his way t Snow White. He touches her face and something happens in him. His demeanor softens and the hint of a smile lands o his lips. Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave 'em to rot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Or skewer him and leave her to rot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would work, too, but my way's cleaner. Note: Coll and Duir have this "at each other but we're comrades" relationship. Coll also has an incessant cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (a beat for emphasis) She is destined. They all trade looks. Muir is the spiritual leader of the group and they dare not speak against him, even Beith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destined?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 124a CONTINUED: (4) 124a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hate the Queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate's a strong word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not strong enough in this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was King Magnus. This carries weight with the group. Impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one listens to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you accompany us to the Duke's castle you will be paid handsomely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need their help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were already lost seeing that you found us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How handsomely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your weight in gold. Each of you. The dwarves trade glances, literally sizing each other up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more than you offered me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodness of your heart, eh, Huntsman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Coll) I get more than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True, but because of your size you eat and drink more, which costs more, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 124a CONTINUED: (5) 124a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, we'll take you, but the huntsman can hang -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of us. Eric looks surprised by her loyalty. So do the dwarves. Suddenly Duir calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riders! The dwarves look round to see a DOZEN SILHOUETTED HORSEME appear on the crest of a DISTANT HILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are the Queen's men, Beith, better decide quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One dwarf's worth a dozen tallsters, I'll take my time thank you -- He suddenly stops as dozens more RIDERS appear on the hil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut him down! MOVE OUT! Nion roughly cuts the line and the Huntsman drops to the ground as Gus gently lifts Snow White. They all hurry dow the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dwarves and their captives arrive at a rocky outcrop. and Coll pull back a large root exposing a cave entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, a short cut. All 8 dwarf heads spin at him - pissed off. Enough with t short jokes. Nion raps Eric's knee with the flat of his dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww!!! Gus cuts Snow White loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nion hesitates, then reluctantly frees the huntsman. DUIR COLL lead the way into a cave. Gus pulls Snow White to sa just as the enemy riders appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From their hidden vantage point, Eric, Snow White, and th dwarves watch the riders searching for them. Some gallop a small troop remain behind. Realizing they have no choic to retreat further, Duir and Coll signal and the dwarves them deeper into the cave system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shaft of light pours through the cave roof high above, circling. The dwarves move effortlessly down the labyrint Snow White and the huntsman have to squeeze through the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White and the huntsman emerge from the cave to see a shimmering landscape of glistening moss and sunlight. It' a mirage. The air is filled with specks of pollen and a s HUMMING NOISE echoes like music. For Snow White, it's the beautiful sound she's ever heard. Next to her, Nion, snor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blasted fairy music. Wish I had some wax to stuff my ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's plenty of moss. GORT scoops up a handful of moss and moulds himself some plugs, sticking them in his ears. Snow White is still mes by the fairy music and the shimmering haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place? The huntsman looks just as dazzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call it Sanctuary, my lady. The Enchanted Forest. It's the home of the fairies. And slowly the hazy curtain gives way to an enchanted for as different to the dark forest as one could imagine -- Life grows everywhere -- LUSH GRASS, PROUD TREES COVERED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White sees tiny figures flying behind the trees -- a too fast to spot -- the pollen following them in long tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pests. Of the other dwarves, only the blind MUIR seems to apprec the beauty around him, enjoying the vibrations on his fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: set up camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEARTY, SOULFUL SINGING. Seated among the ruins, the dwar sing a Celtic ballad as old as time, GUS playing the fidd Coll and Duir sit away from the others, gazing out with t thousand yard stare of hardened war veterans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That song takes me back to the battle of Tylweth Gate. A small horde versus an army. Pickaxes against swords and spears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them were the days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your quailing cough? Coll shakes his head, "dunno". The two of them smile then in the singing. A drunken GORT takes a swig of ale and st over to GUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play louder, you whey-face, I can still hear those harpy fairies. He takes another swig and sings at the top of his voice, tune, trying to drown out the humming of the unseen fairi Snow White and the huntsman look on, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legend has it dwarves were created to uncover all the riches hidden on earth. Not just gold and precious stones, but the beauty in people's hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me, they've lost the art if they ever had it. When the Queen seized their mines she stole their treasure but more than that she stole their pride. And as if to prove it, GORT and NION sing and share from of rum before they tumble to the ground-near Muir as the ends. Eric notices the tumble and chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you pribbling at, longshanks?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing half-wit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm half of nothing.you canker blossom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son?... Sing the one. Perched on his stone, QUERT nods; sings a more CHEERFUL S Eric watches as Snow White walks over to Muir. Before she say anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seat's not taken, if that's what you were about to ask. She sits on the log beside him. Gort and Nion eye her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a log, no need to praise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. For before. For defending me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was a good man. The kingdom prospered. Our people prospered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were more of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye. And that is all Muir will say on the subject. Gort fills

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day the group you see before you went down into the mine for a month long shift. Gus was only a boy. When we came back to the surface... nothing. The land was black, everything, everyone... dead, gone. We searched but... Gort surprises himself by choking up a bit. Muir helps ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the month your father died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As am I, princess. As am I. GUS walks over to Snow White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm a bit spongy to look at, Miss, but would you care to dance-with a little 'un?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be honored. Snow White gets up and dances with Gus as the song picks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nion and Gort watch her dance with Gus. Nion's not impressed, leans in to Gort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust her. And I don't believe in her, no matter what Muir says. Gort is still melancholy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just you and me,... do you think there are any of us left? Do you think perhaps they were merely banished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as the Queen's in charge we'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe that's the point, isn't it? (beat; out of the blue) I feel funny. Queer almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queer. Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your gout? Nion rubs his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. Gort's look goes from Nion to Snow White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think it has anything to do with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much have you had to drink?! The huntsman drains the last few drops of his rum when BE approaches, sitting beside him gruffly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleecing us of all our rum, eh huntsman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say, we let bygones be bygones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, nut-hook. What's in it for you? (off Eric's innocent expression) I'm talking about the girl? Is it really just the gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric watches Snow White dancing with Gus, then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, Beith. If I had any sense I'd have abandoned her long ago. Beith eyes Eric as he watches Snow White dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muir says she's destined. Question is, huntsman, for whom? Gus and Snow White are still dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As Snow White treads on his toes) You don't mind me saying, you got two left feet for a princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind at all, Gus. I haven't danced in a long, long while. She feels eyes on her - turns to see the huntsman watchin with a slight smile. She smiles back and breaks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind, Gus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. Snow White walks over to the Huntsman, holds out her hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've taught me to fight, surely I can teach you to dance. Eric trades a look with Beith, who nudges him on. Eric stands and they proceed to dance, with her teaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palms up, head straight, look me in the eyes. And... The huntsman moves better than you'd imagine. His face ev softens as they both enjoy the dance. Beith looks on with a smile. 130a OMITTED 130a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and the dwarves are asleep. Flowers have grown aroun as if they've been asleep for months. Cull and Duir sleep sitting up, back to back, at the read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muir, also awake and smiling, sits against the log, his h rubbing his son's sleeping head. Snow White sits amazed, drinking in the sights and sounds Animals emerge from the forest -- SQUIRRELS, BEAVERS, FOX BIRDS. Slowly they make their way towards the ruins, gazi Snow White. THE NIGHT SHIMMERS WITH FAIRY LIGHT AS THEY OBSERVE HER. Snow White feels the light on her face and to her surpris sees the two MAGPIES who watched over her at the castle. BEAUTIFUL FAIRIES WITH THE DEER EYES slip out of the magp bodies, beaming at her. As Snow White sits up, they direct her to the woods WHERE DAZZLING LIGHT SHINES THROUGH A TREE. As she walks animal in alongside her. A little way away, Gus snores in his sleep. The golden li crosses his face and he wakes up. As he opens his eyes, h stares in wonder, then quickly wakes the other dwarves. They all stare in amazement now, even the blind MUIR. Eri the last to wake up, wondering what the fuss is all about They rise and follow to --

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TREE
dialogues.text: She stands BENEATH THE GIANT TREE, facing a MAJESTIC WHIT The air around the mystical creature shimmers with a gold light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's ever seen it before. The excited Muir grabs his son Quert by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white hart bows before the princess, father. Sure enough, the HART lowers its head before Snow White. face is lit up in the golden light, his blind eyes shinin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's blessing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have eyes, huntsman, but do not see. You who have been with her the longest. Eric doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is life itself. She will heal the land. She is the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying she is destined?... Muir can only shake his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one listens to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you feel it? Are you ailments not gone? Gold or no gold, where she leads I follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye! The other Dwarves trade looks. Nion, the last, shrugs. As Snow White strokes the hart's neck, the golden light brightens, engulfing her.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE HART'S FLANK.
dialogues.text: The HART roars in pain and bolts. The fairies and animals scatter in all directions now, their sanctuary violated. Eric looks up to see ALDAN the Yakut emerging through the on horseback, notching another arrow to his bow. A FIERCE WIND rips through the sanctuary now, shadows spr where there was once light. Eric sees FINN appear on hors looking like a demon god in the gathering darkness. The huntsman grabs his axe. So do the dwarves, pulling on battle masks. WILLIAM emerges through the trees to see ALDAN aiming his Snow White. He rides into the Yakut's horse, knocking him balance just as he fires -- The arrow narrowly misses Snow White, thudding into a tre grabs her by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! He runs with her into the forest. Aldan turns on William furiously, drawing his curved swor before he can swing the dwarves attack both men -- Eric only has eyes for Finn. They stare at each other in roaring wind, then Finn gallops into the forest after-Sno Eric RUNS in the same direction --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William fends off the furious dwarf attack then rides off pursuit of snow white -- Aldan sees him but is too busy defending himself against and DUIR to give chase --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All around the forest the shadow of death is spreading. G runs, dragging Snow White behind him. Galloping through t trees, WILLIAM spots them up ahead, riding faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bow and arrow at the ready, Eric runs after Finn. All aro the forest is darkening. He follows the sound of gallopin hooves when suddenly they stop. He stops too, notching an to his bow, peering into the gloom and listening. There's a tense silence, then SUDDENLY HE HEARS A NOISE. spins around, ready to fire, when he sees it's only Finn' riderless horse galloping past -- He realizes too late that it's a trick -- FINN EXPLODES O THE DARKNESS, catching him a glancing blow with his sword

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coll and Duir leap up at Aldan, trying to drag him off hi horse, but he's a ferocious fighter, driving them both ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William spots Snow White up ahead. She disappears into th trees and he rides faster. She erupts from behind a branc pulls him off his horse. Gus races over and raises his ax

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus, no! Gus's axe stops inches from William's eyes. Snow White recognizes the young warrior, staring at him in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you at the village. William looks up at her, out of breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. William. Snow White stares in disbelief, tears of surprise welling eyes. Gus looks even more confused, lowering his axe. William slowly rises to his feet, gazing back at Snow Whi when THEY HEAR A TWIG SNAP -- Gus hears it too, spinning around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- To see ALDAN with an arrow notched to his bow --

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: Gus launches himself -- and takes the arrow meant for Sno White. Before Aldan can load another arrow -- William fir arrow of his own, striking him in the chest. The Yakut to over, dead at last but still astride his horse. Snow White falls to her knees in anguish, cradling the dy Gus. He smiles weakly, holding her gaze, then whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shan't leave you, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric charges into Finn with a cry of rage. Finn deflects blow and hurls him back into the trees. Driven by fury, E charges again, but Finn uses his anger against him, ducki under the vicious blow and landing a brutal one of his ow Eric crashes into another tree. His eyes are still full o hatred but his body is weak. Finn smiles in contempt from yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I captured many girls, but your wife was special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fought and then she begged. For her life. Please?!!! You should know she called for you. Your Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know her name?! Eric is shocked, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me. Just before I slit her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard... .- Eric notices a fallen TREE TRUNK behind Finn -- dead bran STICKING UP LIKE SPIKES. Finn steps toward him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you can look for her in the other world and beg for her forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn smiles and raises his sword for the death blow -- wh LUNGES. He throws himself at Finn, his momentum carrying both into THE DEAD TREE'S SPIKED BRANCHES -- The branches pierce Finn's body, their tips digging into flesh. Finn howls in agony --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn writhes, fighting to pull himself free of the branch Eric holds him down, even as the spikes dig into him, for Finn's wounds to stay open - unable to heal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister -- heal me!! --

dialogues.speaker: ENCHANTED FOREST
dialogues.text: -- the SHADOWY ENERGY swirls around Finn's wounds -- but branches keep the wounds open, they cannot heal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna sits at her desk - she is small and alone in the  vastness of the hall. She stares off into space, a quill in her hand - parchmen out before her. Then suddenly her body convulses - the bottle of black in spills - dark tendrils of liquid seep across the papers a the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn ...no!  She falls to the floor - writhing.  She fights hard at first - but then begins to weaken - he power fades as she ages.  Then she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, brother.

dialogues.speaker: ENCHANTED FOREST
dialogues.text: Finn gasps as he feels Ravenna cut him off. Reacts in hor heartbreak as his wounds stop trying to heal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister... Finn twitches for a moment, looks to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel... Then the light goes out of his eyes. He is finally dead. Slowly, Eric pulls himself free of the branches cutting i flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has broken their connection. We pull away from her.  Ravenna's head is down, depleted, forlorn. Completely sti Ink pools around her bony hands. But when she raises her We see conviction, hatred and determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will pay. You will pay!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still bleeding from his wounds, Eric hurries back through forest until he sees Snow White and the seven dwarves gat around Gus's body, chanting a low prayer. Eric stares in surprise, then notices William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? Beith is about to reply when William answers for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is William. I am Duke Hammond's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look familiar. Eric dodges a bit with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the Duke's son doing riding with the Queen's men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking for the princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To protect her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The princess is well protected as you can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who got her this far your lordship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm grateful for your help but I will take her from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to wait for your voice to break before you give me orders - William draws his sword in indignation and Eric draws his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone can draw steel, boy. It takes a man to use it. William is about to react when Snow White turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him, huntsman. He's our friend. He glares but his eyes glisten with tears. Snow White is still bowed over Gus's body, sobbing, mourning. The prayer chant ends. Nion spits with anger and walks aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to convene. They all follow him a few steps away, where they have privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Nion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what happens when dwarves mix with men. We always come out worse. We have big hearts and we'll fight for any cause -- but for what? For some new Queen to call us runts and turn us out of our homes again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've nothing against the girl, but I'm not willing to risk my life for her either, like poor Gus. Beith considers quietly, the other dwarves listening too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Coll) Does this mean we're not fighting the Queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the gold he promised us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What use is gold if you're dangling by your bony neck, you jackdaw?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, the Queen will flay us alive for helping her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White Hart blessed the girl. Nion shakes his head and rolls his eyes, but Beith listen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even our own legends speak of the redeemer who will heal the land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little mutton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lions and wolves in the kingdom have tried to defeat the Queen and failed. Why not a mutton? The dwarves stare at him incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus lost his life because of her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He gave his life for her. As will I if necessary. Look at us. Look at what we've become. They trade looks. They know where he's going with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were once proud, now we pilfer and drink and dream of when we didn't. I am willing to die for a chance at becoming the man I once was. And that is the last word. Quert puts his arm around his father and kisses his forehead. Beith and Gort trade a no and a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUERT sings a CELTIC MELODY OF LOSS as Gus is laid out on funeral pyre. All around him, THE BRIGHT COLORS OF THE ENCHANTED FOREST HAVE FADED and there are no animals and fairies to be seen. It's as if Ravenna's shadow has passe here too. The tough, battle hardened dwarves shed tears l children. Snow White looks heartbroken as Beith lights th pyre. As the flames rise, a HAUNTING LAMENT carries us in the next scene ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quert's SONG CONTINUES as the group make their way across barren hills and into the mountains --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William walks alongside Snow White, glancing at her tenta He waits until the others are out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I left you. She looks over and sees the remorse in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd known you were alive I would have come sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were children, William. You're here now. They reach some steep rocks and Eric turns around, offeri White his hand. She takes it and he helps her up the slop William looks on, feeling jealous. Beith follows Duir and Coll up to the summit of the hill, looks at the surrounding peaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll rest the night at the top of this hill. 148a INT. MIRROR CHAMBER - ROYAL PALACE - DAY. 148a From above - Ravenna stands in the center of the room, surrounded by ravens. She raises her arms and they take flight, circling above her. She lowers her arms and their swirling pattern lowers, until she is completely surround by them - a tornado of ravens. She has become them, and they her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIRE CRACKLES. The dwarves have set up camp. Coll and D sit on a rocky outcrop, Coll braiding Duir's hair while D sharpens his axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how you sharpen an axe. You sharpen downward. Not upward..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father taught me how to sharpen an axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he taught you wrong. He raises the axe, only half in jest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to test it? William watches Snow White warming herself by the fire, t heads over to Eric, who is also keeping watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my place to give you orders. I misjudged you. Eric looks up. He shakes William's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I you. William looks over to where Snow White is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shared a childhood together, before she was taken away. She hasn't changed. She has that same light inside her. Surely you can see it.. Eric looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be blind not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can just get her to the castle, the people.. The people will see it. She's our only hope, Huntsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get her to the castle. Don't worry about that..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've thought about her constantly. Every time I closed my eyes. I can hardly believe I've found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should tell her. She'd appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not telling someone how you feel and living with the regret is a lot worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150a EXT. MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150a Snow White sits on a rock, away from the camp, reflecting quietly. She stares out at the surrounding mountains and valleys w she suddenly senses a presence behind her. She turns in a -- but it's only William. William smiles back gently and whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk with me. They walk into the silver birches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up here it's as if nothing's changed. The world looks beautiful again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be. When you are Queen. Snow White turns, surprised by his words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people of this kingdom hate Ravenna with their very fiber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's strange, but... I feel only sorrow for her. William is taken aback by this but pushes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once people find out you're alive they will rise up in your name. Snow White stares back at him uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes more than a name. I an not my father, William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are his daughter. And rightful heir.

dialogues.speaker: 78A
dialogues.text: 150a CONTINUED: 150a He steps closer, gazing into her eyes devotedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had a choice, I would take you far from here. And keep you safe by my side. But I have a duty. And so do you. They hold each other's gaze, Snow White still ridden with doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 150a CONTINUED: (2) 150a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I inspire? How do I lead men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same way you led me when we were children. I followed you everywhere. Ran when you called. I would have done anything for you. She looks touched by his words, smiling softly, trying to make light of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how I remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... They gaze into each other's eyes, close enough to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember we were always arguing. And fighting. And... She trails off, lost in his gaze. He stops, leans closer kisses her gently. They stay like that a moment, then Wil pulls away, holding something in his hand. Snow White smi as she sees that it's an APPLE. With a mischievous smile, William holds out the apple for Snow White, just like he did when they were children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember this trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With mock innocence) What trick? Snow White holds his gaze, then snatches the apple from h before he can take a bite, raising it to her lips with a smile. As she bites -- 150b OMITTED 150b 150c OMITTED 150c 150d EXT. CAMP SITE/ MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150d. Eric, startled,- awakens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 150e EXT. MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150e As Snow White chews, a flicker of a smile crosses William face. Snow White stares curiously, then suddenly gasps, struggling to breathe -- 150f EXT. CAMP SITE/ MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150f Eric stands up, looks around, dwarves still asleep. He sh William, who wakes at the ready. They walk into the trees and follow -- A SINGLE SET OF TRACKS. 150g EXT. MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150g Snow White staggers back and collapses in the snow, choki from poison. Her eyes water and her vision blurs. The fal William kneels beside her and slowly she sees Ravenna's features burning through, her cold blue eyes gleaming in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCREAM fills the air -- not Snow White but dozens of bi shrieking in the sky above --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and William hear the panicked bird cries and run -- 158a EXT. SILVER BIRCH TREES/ MOUNTAINS - DAY. 158a Snow White's limbs are petrified, frost spreading across cheeks -- but her eyes are open, taking in everything. Ravenna leans over her, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, child, love always betrays us. A sigh escapes Snow White's lips, condensing into steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By fairest blood it was done and only by fairest blood can it be undone. You- were the only one who could break the-spell and end my life, and the only one pure enough to save me. She draws away, unwrapping her sacramental dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't realize how lucky you are, never to know what it is to grow old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 158a CONTINUED: 158a She raises the knife, about to cut out Snow White's heart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see the HUNTSMAN STANDING THERE, AXE IN HAND,

dialogues.speaker: RAVENS FLAPPING AROUND HIM --
dialogues.text: William blasts with a sword at the screeching birds -- Eric goes after her now, swinging his twin hatchets. The ravens scream and pluck at his eyes but he hacks at them fiercely, William joining in, until the shrieking birds finally take to the sky and vanish on the horizon. Eric and William rush to Snow White's side now. The dwarv arrive too, hurrying through the snow. William cradles Snow White in his arms, trying to revive but it's no use. Eric stares in dismay as he sees the poi drain the color from her lips. He kneels down and gazes a her. William turns to the dwarves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at? Help her! The dwarves stare back at him gravely but don't respond. desperate now, irrational --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are dwarves, healers, save her! He grabs the blind seer, MUIR, shaking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something! Muir stares back at him with his empty eyes, tears gliste in them. William collapses in prayer, the light in Snow White's ey almost gone. Eric looks over, sees William's grief is as great as his own, and finally stops fighting. Snow White looks up at William as if she wants to say something, then the light in her eyes goes out. The dwarves are heartbroken. Eric looks dazed. William leans down and kisses Snow White gently on the li He pulls away,.hoping against hope. And then -- Nothing happens. She lies there, lifeless and white as th falling snow. On all the faces - realizing that she is truly gone.

dialogues.speaker: 81A
dialogues.text: 158a CONTINUED: (2) 158a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 158a CONTINUED: (3) 158a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flock of ravens whips across the sky, swooping into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ravens burst into the mirror room and "crash" to the ground. Their swirl becomes -- Ravenna, on all fours, looking worse for wear, surrounded dead ravens. The effort depleted her. She GROWLS as she crawls toward the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What must I do?! Where is she?! Where have they taken her?! Answer me! The mirror just REFLECTS RAVENNA'S weary and aging face.

dialogues.speaker: ANSWER ME
dialogues.text: Nothing. Ravenna releases it all, looks up and quietly pleads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Help me?"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing more pathetic than grovelling desperation. You sicken me, my Queen. The mirror starts to ripple, distorting Ravenna's face in something even more awful. 161a EXT. PLAINS NEAR CASTLE - DAY. 161a A wide shot as the group carries Snow White toward the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White's body is wrapped in a shroud, laid out on a funeral board. William leads it with tears in his eyes. E and the dwarves walk alongside the body, all lost in grie

dialogues.speaker: 82A
dialogues.text: 162a INT. DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE - DAY. 162a Crowds move in to see and mourn the processional. Eric is careful to lower his eyes a bit to keep from being recognized. 162b INT. FUNERAL CHAMBER/ DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE - DAY. 1 Torchlight flickers. Snow White's body is laid out on a funeral bier, her face angelic in death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tent flaps open. William stands before Duke Hammond and h council of LORDS, arguing his case with fierce passion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died for us! For our cause! We cannot hide behind these walls and watch this land die with her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your grief clouds your judgement, my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grief makes me see clearly, father. 163a INT. FUNERAL CHAMBER/ DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE - NIGHT. Eric steps from the shadows up to Snow White's body, flas hand. Drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are. Where it ends. Dressed Up to pretty. He takes another pull from the flask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you're asleep; about to wake-up and give me more grief. Am I right? The he touches her arm. Feels the fabric of her funeral dress. Looks at her face and breaks a bit - losing the drunken swagger and speaking with her as if she was still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You deserved better. And then he answers her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was my wife, princess. That was your question that went unanswered. Sara was her name. When I came back from the wars I carried with me the stench of death and the anger of the lost. I wasn't worth saving. But she did so anyway. I loved her more than anything or anyone. And then I let her out of my sight and she was gone and I became myself again. A self I never cared for. Until you. You remind me of her. Her spirit. Her heart. And now you, too, are gone. You both deserved better. And I'm sorry to have failed you as well.

dialogues.speaker: 83A
dialogues.text: 163a CONTINUED: 163a Snow White lies pale and motionless on the bier. Eric rea down and gently brushes a strand of hair off her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be a Queen in heaven now... He leans down and kisses her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sit among the angels. He finally turns and leaves the chamber, tossing the flas aside, disgusted with himself. As we listen to his footsteps fade we hold on Snow White' beautiful face. For a long time she stays perfectly still

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her lips part ever so slightly, and she lets out an almos inaudible whisper of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 163a CONTINUED: (2) 163a Snow White's eyes open, gazing up at the ceiling, her thoughts far away. There's a strange calm about her now, quiet acceptance, as if she knows what she must do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 169a OMITTED 169a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, carrying all his gear, eyes down, strides toward th gate and a clean getaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the gate.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Huntsman! Eric stops. He's been recognized. Percy catches up to him They share a look and Eric sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I recognized you. Eric sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no quarrel with you. Not anymore. You returned the princess to us. And for that... He hands over a heavy sack of gold. Eric takes it, weighs in his hand. God does he need it, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your money.

dialogues.speaker: 169B CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hands it back and turns for the now open gate. He exit the castle and as the doors begin to close -- SHOUTS OF JOY. Eric spins, wanders back to see what the commotion is all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170a OMITTED 170a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The council session continues. Duke Hammond stares at William gravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My duty is to protect the people who come to me for help. I will defend them with my last drop of blood but I will not abandon these walls. I cannot afford to believe in miracles. He suddenly stops as the SHOUTS outside the tent get loud He goes to the flap, opens it to see -- Snow White , still dressed in her white funeral robes, st at the top of the stairs that leads down into the courtya 171a EXT. COURTYARD - DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE 171a Everyone comes out of their tents and stands beneath Snow White. Her heart pounding, she makes her way down the stairs. All are riveted by the sight of her, as if they'r looking on an angel or a living miracle. Eric makes his way back into the courtyard and he, too, i stunned as he slides in next to the dwarves in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a miracle! Duke Hammond, embarrassed and still stunned by the sight her, walks up the stairs to greet her. Several Generals follow him but stay a few steps below them. Hammond takes her by the hands as they speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your highness... (He can't believe his eyes) We thought you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my lord. William, below, stares at her in joy while his father sti looks dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 171a CONTINUED: 171a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must rest -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have rested long enough. Her voice is gentle but full of quiet conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am ready to ride by your side, my lord, when you face the Queen in battle. The Duke looks speechless for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be no battle, your highness. The best thing you can do for your people is stay safe behind these walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is all I thought to do when I escaped. But I have come to learn there is no peace while others suffer. Have you not learned that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen cannot be defeated. She cannot be killed. And therefore there can be no victory. Snow White hesitates, her heart pounding, then replies:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can vanquish her. Defeat her. I am the only one. She told me so herself. Duke Hammond starts to object, but Snow White's eyes and, her feet, lead her down the stairs to her people. When sh reaches the last step - now at their level - she speaks..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been told that I represent you, that it is my place to inspire you. That is wronct. I am not a Queen, not a leader, not a warrior. Absolute silence in the courtyard as people, lords, knigh hang on her every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You represent me, who I've become - your hopes,: your courage, your will - inspires me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have also been told my place is not to fight but to stay here, safely behind these walls. I will not.

dialogues.speaker: 86A
dialogues.text: 171a CONTINUED: (2) 171a SNOW WHITE (cont'd) I hold life sacred, even more since I've tasted freedom, but I've lost my fear of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 171a CONTINUED: (3) 171a Heads nod, people murmur approval. She has them in the pa of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Ravenna comes for me, I will ride to meet her. And if she doesn't, I will ride to meet her. (looks back at Generals) Alone if I must. (back to people) But if you would join me, I will gladly give my life for you. For this land and its people have lost too much. Eric and the dwarves couldn't look prouder. Duke Hammond stares at her for a moment, then BOWS. A bea then William follows, then all the Lords and Knights. His eyes fixed on Snow White, Eric bows too. Then Beith. Then Muir and his son, Quert. Then Coll and Duir. And finally Gort and Nion. Snow White stands alone, overwhelmed by the faith of the kneeling warriors, and the responsibility on her shoulder 171b INT. MIRROR CHAMBER - ROYAL PALACE - NIGHT. 171b Ravenna raises her head to look into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my Queen! Yes!!!! The Mirror Man laughs because Ravenna's face is younger, energy has returned and we see why when -- WE PULL BACK to reveal several CRONES, young only minutes before, now old and lying on the floor. Ravenna smiles, girding herself for the fight to come.

dialogues.speaker: 87A
dialogues.text: 177a OMITTED 177a 177b EXT. CASTLE - NIGHT. 177b The army is amassed and ready to leave the gates. Snow Wh in full armor, sits astride a white horse, her coat of ch mail glittering in the torchlight. She looks like an ange bearing her fathers standard. Eric rides up next to her. She is happy to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back from the dead and instigating the masses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the Huntsman fights for something other than himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you have need of a brutish soldier. She smiles, moved. He turns his horse to full back, but before he leaves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look fetching in mail. A bugle sounds and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 177c EXT. CASTLE - NIGHT. 177c The Duke's army pours out of the great gate, their torche blazing in the night. From above, it looks like a river o lava coursing through the valley. Duke Hammond roars at t top of his. voice, urging his riders on, and now we see t vengeful fire spreading across the plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna and the general on the balcony. All around, soldi and Guards scurry to look busy lest they draw her wrath (though some can't help but notice her aging appearance. Ravenna sweeps away a map held out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a map to see you've failed me, fool, your face is map enough!

dialogues.speaker: BLACK KNIGHT GENERAL
dialogues.text: Yes, my Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they now?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK KNIGHT GENERAL
dialogues.text: A half day's march away. Every hour their numbers grow. Rebels, peasants and deserters rally to them wherever they -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserters?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK KNIGHT GENERAL
dialogues.text: Yes, my Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK KNIGHT GENERAL (cont'd) They say the King's standard flies again. And now Ravenna understands -- Snow White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them come. Let them break their hearts and skulls on these castle walls and bring my prize to me. You must not harm her. I need her heart -- still warm with blood. As she strides away. To soldiers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victory comes! 178a EXT. PLAINS - WIDE - DAWN. 178a Hammond's army thunders toward the castle. And then they arrive at -- 179 EXT. SAND DUNES OVERLOOKING RAVENNA'S CASTLE - DAWN. Horses crest the hill. And now, all around Snow White, we her army -- not just Duke Hammond's men -- but REBELS -- PEASANTS -- WOMEN -- all willing to follow her. Eric and William ride nearby. One of the Duke's commander arrives to brief him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lord, we only have a few hours before the tide comes in. Not long enough to breach the castle walls. We'll either be completely exposed or drowned by the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any other way in? Tunnels? Caves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my lord. Gloom descends on the gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we are at the portcullis when the sun clears the horizon it will be open. They all look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmistakable brown sludge pours out of a sewage tunnel into the sea. It is the same sewers where Snow White esca We hear the sound of splashing oars and grumbling:

dialogues.speaker: FROM INSIDE THE SEWAGE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: We look out at the faces of the dwarves, peering inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're promised gold and volunteer for manure. How low has the dwarf race sunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi-Ho boys. Off to work. And they begin to crawl inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna stares out. On the distant cliffs she sees the ba of the rebel army. A ray of sunlight pours through the cl lighting up the tiny figure of Snow White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coll and Duir wade through the sewage, their axes held up front of them, not a flicker of emotion on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven dwarves against an army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like them odds. Behind them, Beith covers his nose from the stench, Gort Nion look like they're about to be sick, and Muir and his bring up the rear, the brown slime almost at Quert's mout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times like this I wish I was taller. 183 EXT. SAND DUNES OVERLOOKING RAVENNA'S CASTLE - DAWN. Crashing waves break against the rocks, washing over the Duke Hammond stares at the RISING TIDE in concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we should ride now. They'll have the portcullis up by the time we arrive. Duke Hammond considers, then raises his sword. Snow white glances at the huntsman. He breaks rank and rides closer There's a tense silence, then the Duke BRINGS DOWN HIS SW his riders charge down the dunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna stares out confidently, her eyes still fixed on S White's distant banner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trap door in the courtyard rises and we see Beith's h up, his expert eyes scanning the courtyard until they spo portcullis. Ravenna's guards hurry past without seeing hi taking their positions on the battlements. Beith slips ba into the sewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gatehouse is fifty yards away to left. Half a dozen guards and fifty armed soldiers. Archers on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pulling out a huge knife) Give us a couple of minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White rides across the dunes. All around her, riders along the surf, waves crashing around them. Ravenna's cas comes into the view, the portcullis still down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coll and Duir move stealthily through the busy courtyard, small and fleet they're almost invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenna looks on as her archers take their positions and artillery men load missiles onto their trebuchets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White suddenly sees tiny dots of firelight on the ca walls. Eric realizes what they are and rides faster. The pinpoints of light soar up in the air, growing larger and brighter, until we realize they're FIERY MISSILES. Eric f Snow White's horse out of the way as a fireball explodes from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire rains down on the Duke's army now, panic spreading i ranks. Snow White takes her father's banner and holds it rallying the men and riding on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two unsuspecting guards collapse outside the gatehouse. B the other guards can react, Coll and Duir are on them, mo fast and hard, the assault over in seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beith sees Coll and Duir signal from outside the gatehous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waves crash over the rocks. Fireballs explode in the sand White sees men falling all around her, tears welling in h eyes, but she never falters. As William rides on, he sees castle walls through the smoke, the portcullis still down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUARDS in the gatehouse look over as the door splinte the dwarves come crashing through in their battle masks. though they're outnumbered, the seven fight like demons - the enemy are subdued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the castle walls, archers replace the trebuchets. Snow holds up her shield to protect herself from the sea of ar Up ahead, the portcullis is still down, Duke Hammond's fo circling back as they're trapped against the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must turn back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave my word I would stand with them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge pulley controls the portcullis. Beith, Gort and Ni their pickaxes while Coll and Duir tie up the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's see how this works! -- With a mighty blow of his axe, Beith shatters the chains up the pulley. The counter weights go flying down and the portcullis comes shooting up -- then suddenly stops -- JA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duke's army are still circling the gates, stones and pouring down on them from above. Arrows slam into Snow Wh shield but she still refuses to retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beith peers down at the jammed counter-weights in frustra when he hears a fierce cry. GORT jumps on the counter-wei trying to bring it down. Nion follows, yellingatthetopofh voice. Duir puffs up his proud chest and leapsontoo--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White sees the portcullis shoot up now, the dwarves onto the counterweights for dear life. Smiling in relief, gallops through the open gates with Eric and William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duke's riders charge into the courtyard. ARCHERS fire them from every corner of the castle, but they raise thei shields and leap off their horses, forming a defensive we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her balcony above the portcullis, Ravenna watches he men being slaughtered; she enjoys the spectacle (Ravenna not care one bit about those men). Her eyes are locked on White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her come to me...ALIVE! Ravenna's soldiers are merely there to hold Snow White's back. She has planned the whole thing, calculated every m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a spider waiting in her web, with no concern about h soldiers' situation, Ravenna remains calm and calculated. Ravenna turns around and leaves the balcony to the throne room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOW WHITE rushes into the castle. As soon as she passes door a dozen of Ravenna's men come outside closing the tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Eric, William and their men have to fight the road bl In the courtyard, Ravenna's men are losing more and more Snow White's army will win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and William fight like demons, twice as fast, twice strong . They MUST pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 206a OMITTED 206a 206b OMITTED 206b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow White storms into the throne room. She is breathing heavily, a mix of fear and determination.

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK... KNOCK... KNOCK
dialogues.text: The raven claw ring, taps, resonating through the halls. Ravenna stands at the top of the stairs, the mirror room  behind her.  Snow White approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ends today... I have come for YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My rose has returned  (looking at Gus' small sword) .with a thorn! 207a OMITTED 207a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 207a CONTINUED: 207a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 209a INT. THRONE ROOM - DAY. 209a Eric, William and a dozen men rush in. Ravenna smiles, raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you thorns! In a terrifying tremor, the black ceiling of the throne r starts to shatter into millions of shards.  Snow White turns back to see William, Eric and Hammond's the shards fall down like razor blades.  The men try to protect themselves. Some are caught out an skewered to the stone floor. Ravenna looks down at them i complete satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The millions of black shards circle around Eric and his m completely blocking them and keeping them away from Snow White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come! ... Avenge your father, who was too weak to raise his sword. The millions of shards assemble themselves into three sev foot tall, razor sharp creatures. The DARK FAERIES: Raven ultimate soldiers. Snow White looks at Eric and William - unable to help her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 209a CONTINUED: 209a Eric, William and the other men are completely surrounded these creatures; they move so fast. Eric tries to step aw from them... to no avail. One of the creatures rises in front of William. William tries to slash the creature. His sword goes through and the creature reforms itself ri away. The Dark Faerie opens it's mouth and screeches. William gets smashed aside, saved only by his shield. The Dark Faerie grabs the soldier right behind William and se him crashing into the wall.  Snow White walks up the stairs, torn and powerless. She looks at Eric one last time.  Eric looks back as he fights off a Dark Faerie with his t shields. He knows he does not have much time left but he ready to make the final sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (battle cry!) Kill her! 209b INT. MIRROR CHAMBER - DAY. 209b Snow White braces herself and promptly follows Ravenna in the mirror room. Now Snow White is exactly where Ravenna wants her to be. The two women circle each other like heavyweight boxers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years you locked me away! Ravenna seems to relish this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every day, every hour led you to this ,moment. It burned inside you. It drove you forward, and here you are.. Listening only to her heart, Snow White lunges towards  Ravenna and tries - strikes at her with her sword. Ravenna steps aside and with very little effort - throws to the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Fight. Fight for your land... for your loss and for Hope!

dialogues.speaker: 96A
dialogues.text: 209b CONTINUED: 209b Snow White slams and slides across the floor, she stops u the archway at the top of the stairs. She is dazed.  Ravenna treads on her back, then grabs her hair, pulls he head up to see William and his men being massacred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch them die. You gave them hope and they believed you. You have lead them to their deaths. How foolish your followers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 209c INT. THRONE ROOM - SAME - DAY 209c Eric is trying to stay alive.
